evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew withstands potential defeaters within the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features identified in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim scope.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim scope on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands scrutiny against potential defeaters within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim context, maintaining its validity as a significant procedural anomaly.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim dataset, reflecting deviations from standard operating procedures.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing_737-8AS_9H-QAA_12-25:hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.

assumptions: Communication attempts described imply observable coordination breakdown due to the trainee stopping and instructor taking over.
The aircraft overrunning the TRP is a consequence of coordination failure.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination without errors or overruns, or if the incident was solely due to procedural deviation without coordination failure.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, supporting the presence of communication/coordination breakdown as the trainee stopped and instructor took over. H4 shows the outcome of the breakdown with the aircraft overrunning the TRP and hitting the barrier.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing procedural deviation from communication breakdown; some evidence could also support procedural deviation.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observed and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA aircraft during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim scope on 12-25.

assumptions: The ground markings (TRP) were adequate and visible as intended.
No mechanical or communication issues contributed to the deviation.
defeaters: If evidence showed that the ground markings were inadequate or not visible, this would favor environmental deficiency instead.
If mechanical faults or communication breakdowns were documented as causes, this would change the interpretation.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation in pushback execution by showing the aircraft moved beyond the designated Tug release point, supporting the claim. The discriminator disc:R1_PUSHBACK_PROCEDURAL_DEVIATION|R3_ENVIRONMENT_OR_MARKING_DEFICIENCY favors procedural deviation over environmental deficiency.
